prompt:
Question: I just installed Ubuntu 12.04 on this machine and noticed the fonts on facebook.com look very different from how they used to look on 10.04 or Windows. They seem to be smaller and "washed out" (hard to describe). 

I haven't noticed this problem on other websites

Any idea what could cause this problem and how to fix it? I am using the Firefox and always have for many years on different machines. 

Thanks in advance

Answer:
baseline:
1. Open Firefox
2. Click on the menu button (top right)
3. Select Options
4. Select the Appearance tab
5. Select the Fonts tab
6. Select the "Use system default fonts" option

![enter image description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/Y0ZZY.png)

This will reset the fonts to the default Ubuntu fonts.
finetuned:
**Yes, this is a known bug in Firefox 12 and earlier on Ubuntu 12.04.**

![alt text http://img1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20110911190000/firefox/images/thumb/f/f0/Firefox_12_logo.svg/18px-Firefox_12_logo.svg.png/48px-Firefox_12_logo.svg.png 48px-Firefox_12_logo.svg.png](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/firefox/+bug/940000)
